```{r setup, include=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)
library(viridis)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
	echo = TRUE,
	warning = FALSE,
	fig.width = 8, 
  fig.height = 6,
  out.width = "90%"
)
options(
  ggplot2.continuous.colour = "viridis",
  ggplot2.continuous.fill = "viridis"
)
scale_colour_discrete = scale_colour_viridis_d
scale_fill_discrete = scale_fill_viridis_d
theme_set(theme_bw() + theme(legend.position = "bottom"))

```

##need to change the labels and axis for all graphs

```{r}
# honey bee population for country by year
clean_bee_data %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarise(n = sum(honey_producing_colonies)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = n)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90)) +
  labs(
    title = "Honey Bee Colony Count in the US",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Honey Bee Colonies Across the US"
  )
```

```{r}
# all bee population for country by year
year_county_bee = 
  bee_county %>%
  mutate(colony_count = as.numeric(colony_count)) %>%
  drop_na(colony_count) %>%
    group_by(year) %>%
  summarise(n = sum(colony_count))  

year_county_bee %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = n)) + 
  geom_col() + 
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90)) +
  labs(
    title = "Bee Colony Count in the US",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Bee Colonies Across the US"
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = c(2002, 2007, 2012)
  ) + 
  scale_y_continuous(
    breaks = c(100000, 200000, 225000, 250000, 275000, 300000)
  )
```
